page.title: 10FARMING 3
page.content: Kiln farm has about forty ponies and horses and a donkey. Wendy Bland runs the stables and also does the lessons. There are three lessons. There is the 5.00 pm lesson , 6.45 pm lesson and a 7.00 pm lesson . The 7.00 pm lesson is for experienced riders.The other two lessons are for juniors. Wendy has about 20 stable girls and a man called Derek who helps her run the stables. She does lesson on the first three days of each week . Kiln farm is by Toot Hill in Rownhams Lane. We have a bee farm in our block and Mrs Fielder owns it.It isn't really a farm because it only has five bee hives and Mrs Fielder keeps the honey .Bees have six legs and black stripes. I am talking about the furry Bumblebee which is probably the most common bee.A hive holds 60000 bees and produces 400 pounds of honey.
